description: Describes the history for DAILY, MONTHLY, and QUARTERLY budgets. Budget history isn't available for ANNUAL budgets.

parameters.name: AccountId
parameters.description: The account ID of the user. It's a 12-digit number.

parameters.name: BudgetName
parameters.description: A string that represents the budget name. The ':' and '" characters, and the '/action/' substring, aren't allowed.

parameters.name: TimePeriod
parameters.description: Retrieves how often the budget went into an ALARM state for the specified time period. Start (datetime) --- The start date for a budget. If you created your budget and didn't specify a start date, Amazon Web Services defaults to the start of your chosen time period (DAILY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, or ANNUALLY). For example, if you created your budget on January 24, 2018, chose DAILY, and didn't set a start date, Amazon Web Services set your start date to 01/24/18 00:00 UTC. If you chose MONTHLY, Amazon Web Services set your start date to 01/01/18 00:00 UTC. The defaults are the same for the Billing and Cost Management console and the API. You can change your start date with the UpdateBudget operation. End (datetime) --- The end date for a budget. If you didn't specify an end date, Amazon Web Services set your end date to 06/15/87 00:00 UTC. After the end date, Amazon Web Services deletes the budget and all the associated notifications and subscribers. You can change your end date with the UpdateBudget operation.

nested_params.name: Start
nested_params.description: The start date for a budget. If you created your budget and didn't specify a start date, Amazon Web Services defaults to the start of your chosen time period (DAILY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, or ANNUALLY). For example, if you created your budget on January 24, 2018, chose DAILY, and didn't set a start date, Amazon Web Services set your start date to 01/24/18 00:00 UTC. If you chose MONTHLY, Amazon Web Services set your start date to 01/01/18 00:00 UTC. The defaults are the same for the Billing and Cost Management console and the API. You can change your start date with the UpdateBudget operation.

nested_params.name: End
nested_params.description: The end date for a budget. If you didn't specify an end date, Amazon Web Services set your end date to 06/15/87 00:00 UTC. The defaults are the same for the Billing and Cost Management console and the API. After the end date, Amazon Web Services deletes the budget and all the associated notifications and subscribers. You can change your end date with the UpdateBudget operation.

nested_items.name: BudgetPerformanceHistory
nested_items.description: The history of how often the budget has gone into an ALARM state.

nested_items.name: BudgetName
nested_items.description: A string that represents the budget name. The ':' and '" characters, and the '/action/' substring, aren't allowed.

nested_items.name: BudgetType
nested_items.description: The type of a budget. It must be one of the following types:

nested_items.name: CostFilters
nested_items.description: The history of the cost filters for a budget during the specified time period.
(string) ---
(list) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: CostTypes
nested_items.description: The history of the cost types for a budget during the specified time period.

nested_items.name: IncludeTax
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a budget includes taxes.

nested_items.name: IncludeSubscription
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a budget includes subscriptions.

nested_items.name: UseBlended
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a budget uses a blended rate.

nested_items.name: IncludeRefund
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a budget includes refunds.

nested_items.name: IncludeCredit
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a budget includes credits.

nested_items.name: IncludeUpfront
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a budget includes upfront RI costs.

nested_items.name: IncludeRecurring
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a budget includes recurring fees such as monthly RI fees.

nested_items.name: IncludeOtherSubscription
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a budget includes non-RI subscription costs.

nested_items.name: IncludeSupport
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a budget includes support subscription fees.

nested_items.name: IncludeDiscount
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a budget includes discounts.

nested_items.name: UseAmortized
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a budget uses the amortized rate.

nested_items.name: TimeUnit
nested_items.description: The time unit of the budget, such as MONTHLY or QUARTERLY.

nested_items.name: BudgetedAndActualAmountsList
nested_items.description: A list of amounts of cost or usage that you created budgets for, which are compared to your actual costs or usage.

nested_items.name: BudgetedAmount
nested_items.description: The amount of cost or usage that you created the budget for.

nested_items.name: Amount
nested_items.description: The cost or usage amount that's associated with a budget forecast, actual spend, or budget threshold.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: The unit of measurement that's used for the budget forecast, actual spend, or budget threshold.

nested_items.name: ActualAmount
nested_items.description: Your actual costs or usage for a budget period.

nested_items.name: Amount
nested_items.description: The cost or usage amount that's associated with a budget forecast, actual spend, or budget threshold.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: The unit of measurement that's used for the budget forecast, actual spend, or budget threshold.

nested_items.name: TimePeriod
nested_items.description: The time period that's covered by this budget comparison.

nested_items.name: Start
nested_items.description: The start date for a budget. If you created your budget and didn't specify a start date, Amazon Web Services defaults to the start of your chosen time period (DAILY, MONTHLY, QUARTERLY, or ANNUALLY). For example, if you created your budget on January 24, 2018, chose DAILY, and didn't set a start date, Amazon Web Services set your start date to 01/24/18 00:00 UTC. If you chose MONTHLY, Amazon Web Services set your start date to 01/01/18 00:00 UTC. The defaults are the same for the Billing and Cost Management console and the API.

nested_items.name: End
nested_items.description: The end date for a budget. If you didn't specify an end date, Amazon Web Services set your end date to 06/15/87 00:00 UTC. The defaults are the same for the Billing and Cost Management console and the API.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: A generic string.
